Kraven set forth on such an information campaign but was met with rebukes and violence. His lycanthropic form was incredibly dangerous in defence of many violent altercations, many of which unfortunately resulted in murders.

Kraven thus turned his hand to what was in his heart: sailing, artwork, shadows, magic, mystery, and music. Combining these passions, Kraven is one of the first and only tattoo artists in the region who can offer magic tattoos - at a costly price.

Will be found in archery competitions. He is also well-known for his tattoo art and can provide those passing through a city with mystical or magical tattoos. He rarely sets up within a busy market and prefers a corner in a tavern or inn where he can also perform and is often offered good sums of coins to remain a staple at well-known pubs and alehouses.

Friendship and emotional or sexual intimacy are Kraven's greatest desires. Not keen on morality or self-actualization, per se, he often tries to impress others at the cost of fulfilling his own desires.

Bridging on elderly looking; Worn skin and sunken features; Small poke tattoos on his face, neck, and hands; Wears a dusty old semi-formal outfit - Jacket, button-up, slacks, and boots; crewcut; small leather cap

"Can never make a truly fair trade - so might as well go with the flow"; "The things we do, the things we do...why do we do the things we do?"; "I once bought a large slice of land from a tribe of hobgoblins and sold it to an enemy tribe just to watch the party";

Bows with a twirling wrist, sardonically, as if to say, 'you obviously will think you're better than me'; Drops into a daze and traces ancient sigils in the air, only to fall still again; mild OCD - walks in patterns counting steps, opens a door at the count of three, obviously counts coins out loud during transactions, etc.

The "Pennymore Con" is in search of a magic stone with sigils carved into it. It passed through his fencing shop and in the process captured an aspect of his soul. He doesn't know what it does but he knows it will bring him riches at the expense of others so he never says anything, but instead dreams of it night and day.

As is well known across the Realms, Elves live a very long time. During these extensive life-spans, they are susceptible to major life changes, whether in vocation, direction, location, or what-have-you. Nobody knows where the Con hails from, they only know that he is a Sylvan Elf because of his gaunt, lanky, and gruff appearance, ruddy skin and hair, and his bright silverish eyes. Nobody is sure what life trajectory brought the Pennymore Con to where he is today. The few things that are known about him could be myth.

The Con is blamed across the Realm for various high-level robberies and for starting various skirmishes between nations by offering a contract on an important local Duke in exchange for a long-sought after item that had been fenced to him. Constantly seeking business with members of every eschelon of a city or town, the Con is open about his business dealings but opaque as to his motivations. Consequently, although suspected of high crimes, none have been proven and the Con is allowed free movement. In fact, his movement is likely advocated among higher magistrates because of the goods and services they've obtained from him through less-than-legal means.

This sketchy old elf is something of a myth more than a man. He remains well out of sight of guards and militia yet regularly has secret dealings with the middle to upper eschelons of local political factions. If adventurers passing through town appear to have valuable items or be capable of acquiring such items, he will contact them through secret letters via an innkeeper or bartender and arrange a meeting in a private place. He may also commission a particularly remarkable group to find certain valuable items.
The Con is known for using trade in valuable goods as a means for inciting conflict on a large scale. He desires to go down in history as the catalyst for some great war.

A tall and flamboyantly dressed golden Dragonborn. His shining gold scales are well kept and freckled with dark red umber. He carries a beautiful Doss Lute with flourishing vigor as if he wants all to see his prize posession.

"Ever been trapped in a storm at sea? Your personal problems disappear into the foam of the waves"; "Slaving is slaving. Aren't we all slaves to something?"; "Everyone has a price. Just some are aware of it"; "Not my problem"

Wheeler is almost constantly swaying, as though some shanty is playing in his head. He often bursts into rousing shanties while adventuring or even just browsing a market place. This is especially likely when the ale is flowing.

A largely forgotten child of a wealthy Dragonborn family nearly obliterated by discriminating Elven and Human armies, Captain Wheeler became something of a man-whore chasing females for personal validation. In these seedy social circles, he connected with the Violet Conch, a high-sea slaver group who traded in peoples of any race or social class so long as it was profitable. Realizing his opportunity at wealth (and not caring that others would suffer) Captain Wheeler trained with the Violet Conch, learning the 'ropes' of sailing and trading peoples as goods. The process largely wore down his moral compass.

Regardless of these heavy experiences, Wheeler (renamed by his sailmates - his original name only known to him at this point) is well known as the 'beast who inspires' or the 'spirit of the wandering sailor' because of his profound fecundity with respect to sea-shanties. Those shanties have become even more renown because of their magical effects - often saving sailors and their ships in crisis.
Captain Wheeler will offer to sail a party to a distant land. He may be encountered during a slave trade or some other trade of foreign goods.

He isn't dismayed by slaving, per se, but instead hopes to 'refine' the trade by only including particular races or economic positions. Does he prefer dwarves? The poor? What do the clientele think are the most worthy? Wheeler just goes with it.
Beautiful Doss lute, fashioned from olivewood with a neck of scented rosewood, inlaid with ivory.

Paralysed on her left side, Moss walks by lifting one graceful, strong leg, then stamping and clobbering the floor with her rigid half. Her face is half frown, lips curled down, and half expressive. White stripes streak her roiling black curled hair.
"Woman's oldest profession, next to seamstress..."; "Men are nuts"; "Take in, dearie, take in."
A facial tick causes Moss to wince, the right side of her face folded into ridges, while the left side of her face remains unmoved in its permanent sadness.
Moss loves flowers, especially perennials (rododendrons are among her favourites; she also grows numerous ferns at the royal gardens, and eats the fiddleheads in spring); and chamber music.
Distrustful of men; sometimes overly trustful of women and children, to the point of being occasionally gullible.

Whispering to an Amyrillis that "the current war will end soon", a young Moss heard a quiet voice in her head.

You have the gift, child.

Moss was suddenly struck with a channel of supernatural energy from beyond. Her mind was filled with visions of nature while her body was struck with unfortunate disabilities. At this point, when the Goddess of Blooms, without location but existing within every seed and petal, touched her, Moss became aware that she was destined for more than a life arranging flowers for others.

Moss' real name is lost in time. Raised in a testosterone fueled environment with 3 brothers and a long-passed mother, Moss was beleaguered with pseudo-abuse directed towards her womanhood. She absorbed these in her youth, thinking it was normal, but after being touched by the Goddess of Blooms she realized the horrors of which men are capable. In this moment another insight was whispered directly into the center of her mind.

Men are but the seeds. Save the soils, milady. Bless the petals. Love the stems. Revere the roots. But we will always be able to produce more seeds.
A face peers up from behind a basket of flowers being watered. "I see the hoodlum convention is in town again," the woman says from one side of her mouth.
Moss leads a simple life, finding pleasure in tending gardens and arranging bouquets. She is meticulously clean, believing that to scrub is to be free.
Many exotic roots, traded with travelers.
Brown sleek furred skin, snout, black eyes, gilled cheeks. Webbed fingers, flippered feet, spinal ridge to his tail.
WILL THERE BE A WAR?; DEATH RAYS TURN WHOLE CONTINENTS INTO DUST; DO YOU WANT PERFUMED BREATH? USE "FRESH" TOOTHPASTE.
Wags tail underwater when excited; barks when happy or scared; performs "the newt", his underwater dance, on request.
Will never be accepted into a human social group so as to satisfy his yearnings; has never had an original thought.

Nobody can be sure how Scheuschzeri ended up in the ponds. But everyone kows that he hears the best of the news because he's always treading water in a well-placed pond. Scheuschzeri will spend most of his time in deeper waters by the wharf in the sea-side frontier village of Griptight Keep [Any Seaside Trading Village] overlorded by the pirate baron Koon The Bold. He spends daytime hours skipping out of the wharf into the various marshy puddles that characterize the paths of the village overhearing conversations. He's become so attuned to these interactions and the value of their content to others that he often positions himself in the best spots to overhear the best possible informations.

How did poor Scheuschzeri become this this way? Nobody is completely certain. Some claim that he was once a pirate who had fallen in love with a Siren while at sea and upon his attempt to capture her heart she laughed in his face and banished him to the ponds and wharf-side. Others tell a story of how it was his own choice; that he is actually a powerful sorcerer who grew tired of his capabilities and cast this polymorph on himself in reverence of the greater society.
He/him (though many refer to him as "it")
From the wharfside water comes a hoarse croaking voice: "WILL PELHAM BEAUTY OR GOBERNADOR WIN THIS YEAR'S DERBY?"
Gossips incessantly, and strangers gossip to him; reads every pamphlet ever printed; parrots the town crier verbatim.
Beautiful, immaculate, slender for a halfling; one letter pasted to each eyelid; carries a silvery fruit in one hand.
"We are all ku"; "Your thoughts are like my dresses, the waistlines all identical"; "All dreams were dreamt long ago."
Stands on toes, like a ballerina; arches eyebrows; holds hands over her eyes when she closes them to think.
Remembers none of her native halfling language but the word "ku" (a fish-scaled fruit with a pulsating stone at heart).

Princess Ateh may or may not be a princess anymore. The Khazar kingdom [A halfling kingdom that has been lost (or maybe not!)] did not fair well in the Goblin and Hobgoblin raids of the Dark Reckoning of Rakosh Ghaal [Any Goblinoid or Orcish Deity]. Largely razed to the ground, the Khazar kingdom was once a bright kingdom populated by loving and generous halfings and their ilk. Ateh was among their best. Having been driven from her kingdom by war and subsequently hunted by the vicious dark forces of Rokash Ghaal, Ateh now remains in hiding yet continues her well-skilled political performances for various factions within the realms to promote equality and abundance.

Her people believed in the beauty imparted by by Ku, her people's concept of a central spiritual entity. The philosophy of Ku dictates that all things happen at the same time and that time is merely the gift of enjoying every moment that has existed or will exist. Her beliefs fuel her beauty and her beauty fuels her beliefs.
Poetess, philosopher, court advisor, conquered princess
A young halfling woman bars your path. "Between us, a captured puma on a rope. How are we to approach each other?"
Recovering her lost language, which she promptly forgot upon the khagan's conversion during the Khazar Polemic.
Human, Draconic, dwarvish, elvish, gnomish, orcish, troll (but not halfling, except for one word)
Cutout letters that will kill a would-be assassin on sight; she pastes these on her eyelids at night, before sleep.
Red eyes, half-grey moustache, bite mark on left forearm. Well-poised. Nose ring; feedbag on belt around waist.
"Hela!", "Khlum!", "We have a saying: tsu khlum iz tsu lebn: you will not find what you seek with your eyes open."
Suave. Measures and tracks the speed of clouds. Speaks a language he does not know in his sleep.
Learns skills while sleeping (including sword-fighting) that challenge his lack of waking muscle memory.

When someone needs something dirty done, something that will inspire ire in the minds of the local guard or militia, one does not turn to a friend or even an acquaintance unless they wish trouble to descend upon their home or business. Instead, one turns to a paid person, a person who they may only know through stories at the tavern or from the songs of a bard. Samuel Cohen comes up in both story and song. His dreams ring of each story and lyric. A haunting or a gift? Not even Samuel can tell.

Samuel is an orphan. He hasn't received word from the clergy as to who his parents were or the circumstances through which he was dropped off. One thing he does know is that he doesn't really care. Family is for the blind. His youth in the orphanage in a small town was as expected: violent and traumatizing. He learned quickly the value of exchanging things or coins for safety or services. What's more, and what he may not have even consciously learned, per se, was from the conditioning imposed upon him by the clergy of Khalal [A separatist sect turned sour], a deity of scarcity largely followed by the marginalized and desperate. These priestesses and nuns would subject the children to questionable behavior modification experiments in their sleep. Their goal was to remove the resentment and contempt from the desperate and replace it with gratitude and hope. Little did they know, they had created entire worlds in the minds of their guinea pigs.

Upon release from the clergy during his adolescence, Samual vowed to care about only one thing: how he could advance himself in the waking world.
A tan elf with one end of a long string tied to a stake in the road chases the shadow of a cloud down the street.
Travels great distances in his dreams, searching for the one who is dreaming his own waking life.
The Dictionary of the Khazar Halflings, unbound loose leaf pages in his feedbag, written in Death Ink.
Expensive black silks wrapped tightly around her strong limbs; a short skirt of leather; mail bundles strapped to skirt.
"Hey you!"; (seizing clothes) "I LOVE this!"; "Crew love!"; (rolling eyes) "Oh my gods"; "Right?"
Laughs at everyting "Ah! Ah! Ah!"; attention focused on one correspondent at a time, except when dogs are present.
As a child, a snow elf pierced the back of her head with a magical arrow, whose curse still overcomes her periodically.

The Drow are a largely rejected race in the Realms. Numeorus tribes have departed from traditional ways in hopes of achieving peace for themselves and between themselves and the denizens of the Upper World. The clans of Dire Dawa [Any Underdark Village] seek such noble ends. A self-appointed council of diplomats in this village have made it their goal to spread the word that the people of the Underdark are best set to survive and flourish with the cooperation of the other races of the Realms.

Since most magic is under strict control within most of the Underdark and thus messages and missives are difficult to convey, the peoples of Dire Dawa needed to rely on actual footwork to pass messages between and across the peoples of the Underdark who sought to escape the control of the few dark deities who had gained the majority of control in the regions. They relied on 'runners' to bring messages back and forth. Abrinet was chosen as one of the few to plat this revered position.

Although not the fittest or most able, it was her commitment to absolving the Underdark of its ills that convinced her town council to appoint her as a 'runner'. She has yet to let them down, except for her more than occasional travels to the Upperworld.
A flash of black silk swishes past you, and you stumble. "Oh my gods, I am so sorry!" the dark elf turns and bows.
Everyone needs a torch to sparkle and shine in the dark; Riley focuses her light on everyone else. Leads run group.
Dog Vlad at home with her husband; Steam Shoes, filled with coal and ignited to double movement for 1-4 hours.
Cross-eyed; powerful, like a wild cat; intense; wears showy expensive jewelry, bits of coloured paper pasted on pants.
(Interrupting) "I know what you're going to say"; "I think very, very deeply"; "You're where I was at ten years ago."
Constantly rubbing knuckles, flexing his jaw and his triceps; sighs in disappointment whenever others speak.
Control freak; doesn't let others speak; flies into rage if anyone doubts him; why will nobody follow his leadership?

There really aren't any swamp Gnomes. Except for Yasloh. Emerging from a mountain cave on a dimly glimmering morning, the Gnome sputtered at the sun, "Yes, yes, I know that already", and coughed up a bit of flem in his hand. He slapped his hands together and rubbed them vigorously, laughing to himself. "What does this day have to offer?" He stepped forward out of the cave and his foot found no ground. The black swamps of Kol-oug had deceived yet another. Whoever Yasloh used to be was absorbed into the gritty sandy mire of Kol-oug. How could I have forgotten the bloody swamp? Was the last thought that crossed his mind before the Mind Flayer pit swamp consumed his identity.

Three days later a small humanoid limped his way towards a makeshift Halfling military camp. "Who goes there?", cried the lieutenant. The "Brain" began to reflect upon itself and found nothing. Well, who does go here? He asked himself. Nothing. "Who goes there?" The lieutenant asked again. Oh, well, I had better answer him. He seems important. "Brain!" Yasloh shouted the only thing he could think. "Brain" approached the militia party having all the smarts he had before but having no idea who he actually was. "Oy, innit a gnome...", the halfling lieutenant remarked, "covered in muck". "Yes", Yasloh replied, "a swamp gnome". "But there's no such..." Yasloh shot the soldier an intimidating glance. Silence. They gave "Brain" a place to clean up and change.

During this reflection time his mind filled with criss-crossing images of shimmering grids and incoherent numbers and languages. These hallucinations eventually began to congeal into gears, sigils, machinations, glyphs, and locations of great power. It appeared as though Yasloh had fallen asleep in the bath at the camp and he began muttering incomprehensibly in an increasing volume until he was nearly shouting. A young Halfling soldier approached to shake him awake. "Sir. Sir? Are you okay? Are you..." And Yasloh shot up in the bathtub screaming valorously, "I've got it mate!" He may have lost his past but now saw the many magical inventions that would define his future.
"You're carrying that wrong," declares a robed, trinketed gnome, walking youward. "Let me share my learnings with you."
Wants to lead other wizards in the building of new, never-before-invented magical devices; sees himself as a mentor.
Thaum gauge on a wristband, a personal thaumometer used to detect concentrations of magical potential.
Black skin with tints of purple and ochre, smouldering eyes, thin lips, well-dressed with leather high-stacked boots.
"Howdy"; "Y'all"; "Ah reckon"; "Ain't no thang"; "Pitchin' woo"; "By golly"; "Here's a florin for your troubles."
Steady, ponderous. Never a quick or jerky movement. Watches everyone and everything with interest.
Restless. Can't stay put or keep three past families together to save their life. Lonely, seeking. Underappreciated.

Needless to say, Orcs aren't known for their navy. Yet that isn't to say that Orcs aren't sea-savvy. Born and raised by the Yellow Teeth tribe in the Northern Wastes of Kalauzumar [Any Remote Wasteland], Nagata was taught in swamp navigation and eventually in how to navigate the more shallow seas that surrounded the Wastelands. An ambitious youth, they dreamed of a life on the seas. But they knew this wouldn't be possible within the confines of their tribe. Although they tried their hands at engineering various war machines for their tribe and were actually quite talented at it, this couldn't possibly compare to their dreams of living a life on the high-seas.

Although they loved their people, they loved the sea more. After yet another unecessarily violent raid by their tribe on a sea-side frontier town they all made their way back towards the black swamps they deemed their home. Nagata was dismayed. They took a quick look around at the crew, made a broad and clearly unsuspicious gesture towards the starboard bow of the ship and whistled clearly (a known call for their shipmates) and then made a deliberate and unnoticeable dash to the port side of the ship diving off quietly into the water.

Nagata swam to shore unnoticed and sat on their knees. They ran their fingers through the sand, muttering, "dear sea, you have me".
A slender spire of an orc spills gears and belts from a jute sack at your feet. "Ah'm sorry, y'all, ah'm fallin' apart!"
Brilliant with devices (clocks, thieves' tools, autocarpentry). Quiet, unassuming, straightforward and honest.
Rocinante, an auto-nag devised by Nagata to remind them of calendar events. "Y'all have an appointment in 10 minutes!"
Black conflagration of hair, she wears midnight. Her full-lipped pout would harden a paedophile's resolve.
"Phony"; (derogatory) "that's very clever"; "Show me a story"; "Let's paint pebbles together"; "I hate everything."
Drawing with chalk or charcoal on every nearby surface. Her eyes moisten when she feels she's said the wrong thing.
Hates everything and just about everybody. Her imagination seeks escape from intellectual and artistic void of home.
"Are you a giraffe?" A young lady wrapped in swirls of black stands before you, hands on hips, head cocked to one side.
She longs for a man who reverences her. She enjoys plays and clowns and impromptu acting.
A ruby she keeps hidden at home, locked in a dresser drawer, for the right man: the only object of colour she owns.
Shy, awkward, fearful. Brimming with suppressed creativity. Moustache, liver spots in cheeks, yellow eyes.
"I don't know as if I can answer that"; "What would the Vivian Girls think?"; "We should start a society together."
Brushing strands of grey hair over eyes; speaking with hand over mouth to block spittle.
Thoroughly repressed; scarred by early life in the Orphanage for Godless Goblinoids; fond, but terrified, of children.
The moonlit street is empty but for a pigeon-toed man, eyes down, mop under arm, shuffling slowly in a straight line.
Dharja yearns for a world in which all goblin children are free to eat snot and masturbate; his yearning fuels his art.
Twelve-thousand page tome he is writing and drawing with the aid of pictures, some lewd, cut from other manuscripts.
Heavily greased blonde hair; clothes once expensive but now shabby; penetrating blue laser-eyed gaze.
"I mean"; "Like I say"; "Low dwarves"; "I'm not a racist, but some of them bottomdarks will make any man racist".
Dabs lips with napkin after every sip; straightens collar; flattens wrinkles out of shirt. Nods when speaking.
Pacifist, afraid of fighting, yet often incites violence with his stories full of racial invectives.
Clustered around a long, pint-heavy table, listeners clap and toss coins into a wood burl bowl. "Thankee kindly!"
Loves storytelling; has found that rousing racial tensions increases profit, so plays on fears of "the other".
Wipe the Bottoms Society, Storytellers Against Goblins, Justice for Us, Humans Going Their Own Way
The Call of Stronginthearm, his magnum opus, transcribed by an adoring fan, about religious cannibal lust among dwarves.

Reina was cursed as a young child, possibly for something her outlander parents did. She was given the Curse of the Forgotten which allows only characters with high perception (16) to even see her and only characters with exceptional perception (19+) to remember she exists if they arent directly looking at her. This has left Reina to raise and fend for herself from a young age.

She longs for friends and connection while doing what she needs to to survive. She longs to return to the barbarian clan that forgot her as a child but lives on city streets as a pick pocket and thief.

What Reina doesnt know about herself is a very dangerous secret for everyone.... Reina is The Wraith! Her curse is actually a spell put on her a spymaster of the assassins guild at the same time that he murdered her tribe and created her split personality. When her skills are needed a simple subliminal phrase brings out the Wraith, the realms deadliest assassin, and Reina never remembers a thing.
You turn to find a small human girl in furs relieving you of your coin purse. Wait.... you can see me?
Small for her age, mousy and dishevelled, dressed in furs and linens thats she has clearly scavenged. That is... if you can see her at all.
You can see me? Im very forgettable. Even my family forgot me.
Motivated by fear and loneliness. Shes looking to find out why she is the way she is, for friendship and to be remembered.
She doesnt, she just has one she doesnt know
Shes overly trusting of anyone who sees her, remembers her and shows her kindness

item.title: Yemik Rothoar
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: A new student of magicks and lores

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
Orphaned at a young age, Yemik does not remember his family.

Yemik spent his days learning to read at the orphanage and eventually was requested to live at a school for the gifted. A prof. took him in as an assistant and fed Yemik's curiosities.

Yemik has a desire to give the world the gift of knowledge, hoping to make a book that would be in every household.
Young adult half-orc with black shaggy hair. Taller than average with a thin build. Reading glasses that never seem to leave his face.
Knowledge is power. A mistake is another opportunity to learn.
Writing a guide to help new adventurers. Finding magical objects to help fund his expeditions.
Yemik has a keen interest in devil contracts, orc culture, and coffee
Yemik knows how to summon a devil, though has yet to do so.
His thirst for knowledge. He is also allergic to peanuts.
Yemik can be found researching a local magical anomaly, or seeks a party's help in retrieving a magical object
A new student of magicks and lores
Scholars Gloves: enchanted to give rough summaries of any book he touches.

item.title: Figus Figora
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: Researching in a library; Town; CIty

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: He is a bald triton with teal skin, he has a crab familiar.
Everyone should learn to read, it is what allows us to grow as civilizations.
He likes to research obscure knowledge and magics to help civilization grow.
He loves books, but also loves fire and is a pyromaniac Triton. He constantly tries to reconcile these.
He is obsessed with knowledge and will put himself in danger to obtain it, without clearly thinking of the consequences.

He grew up in a Triton city and lived there until his early teens, when he accompanied a team to dry land for the first time, where he saw a firestorm and while the other Tritons avoided it, he felt irresistibly drawn to it and has loved fire since.

However, he once accidentally burned a valuable book while playing with the fire and is constantly looking for ways to feed his pyromaniac self while not burning any books and avoiding the natural uncomfortable feeling that most Tritons have around fire.
Wants some assistance in researching obscure lore. He approaches the party to ask them to visit a distant location or library.

A tall, immensely broad shouldered, human with salt and pepper medium length hair. Tanned skin show his years of wandering. Scars cover his body. His love of beer caused him to develop a slight pot-belly in more recent years, but he still exudes dangerousness.
Want to arm wrestle? Let me show you my trophy collection [of swords].
Draake leads a band of about 100 bandits. He commands his men and women fairly and they look up to him.
His brother is secretly the local lord. The two communicate via matching message rings. The lord tells him which caravans to raid.
He can't resist physical contests and will take any challenge. He gambles away large sums of money.

The 2nd born son of a local baron, Draake could never stay still.

As a young boy, he was formally trained as a knight. He and his brother Trassel were inseperable, but Draake knew he would never rule and he hated the pomp of court life.

At 16 he left the castle in the night looking for adventure. He found it in a tavern where he met Taron. The two teenagers quickly became friends. Leaving his hometown of Oxlight behind him, the two adventured far and wide, both starting and ending many fights along the way. During this time, the charismatic Draake convinced more adventurers to join their ranks.

At 24, Draake was captured on a raid and brought back to town. His brother, now Lord, almost didn't recognize him. Granted clemency, the two agreed to enrich each other.

Trassel ensured that Draake would become the local bandit leader by sending his soldiers against all other gangs and in return Trassel recieved a cut from every raid. Draake would keep the gang in line and would take new recruits (criminals from Oxlight) which helped lower expenses for Trassel and made him look better to the king. This arrangement has persisted for the last 26 years.
Ha, what a fine sword you have. Let's have an arm wrestling contest. Winner gets the loser's prized sword!
Hand Axe +2, Hand Axe +1, Boots of Speed
With a formal greeting, he seeks participants for an experiment or to escort a magical item to a foreign ruler.
at will captapult spell at 4th level
shield spell doesn't consume a spell slot
three indestructible metalic balls, each wieghing 10 pounds each. +3 leather, a blind fold that magically rejects all charm or hypnosis
Well, this is quite the mess. Wat? oh dear. Do you require assitance? Then disappear.
He wants to discover how to consistenly be reborn, how to retain that knowladge, and without breaking natural order.
The secrets of how to create life without breaking the natural or divine order.
A noble that discovered just truly how small he was, he gave up on big dreams and decided he wants to out last everything, or at least to the point he could experience everything .
He always looks like he just woke up. His skin is pale, blue eyes, slender bulid, hair hasn't been cut for 6 month. he dress in blue royal atire, or a very light blue lab coat

item.title: Odinson Ironbeard
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: Athgrad a place with high mountains and cold climates

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Elemental hammer,Shield of iron bulwurk, armor of the titans, belt of titans strength, pendant of imortality
Older dwarf long white beard with medium length hair, scale armor and a iron shield with a hammer the shield looks like and old beat up heater shield
Useally grumpy looking like he trusts not a person
Old war vet of the iron war of the mountains
He passionate about his old war adventures he used to have with his party
He knows the secrets of magical and elemantal blacksmithing
His love for his daughter Grizelda, his wife Tristan and beer
Hes an old war veteran from the iron war, he knows sylvia anf clint from the war
He is an old friend of a npc who has information of the npcs whereabouts
Tall and thin with brightly color feather patterns on his wings. Sharp beak and large aven eyes. lightly armored
Screeeech, "I will not go in there", "The sky is my home"
freedom, family and occasionally shiny objects
The whereabouts of his tribe's nest
very claustrophobic, panics in confined spaces.

Urreeek is and elder of his tribe who have been trapped on the material plane. He has been sent out into a world he wants nothing to do wih to find help getting him and his tribe back to the Elemental Planes of Air
A chance encounter while hunting for food for his clan. Looking for aid against a common enemy of his tribe

item.title: Oorruk The Seeker
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: Seeking the Rod of Seven Parts

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Seeking the Rod of Seven Parts
Swoops down on the party from the sky asking for their aid

He has long ago left his tribe behind on the Elemental Planes of Air in order to serve his God's the Wind Dukes of Aaqa in order to restore to them the Rod of Seven Parts to help defend his plane from elemental evil
He's fragile and extremely claustrophobic even though he pretends hes not
A slight wizened bird-man with graying feathers and bright, intelligent eyes
Finding the pieces of the Rod of Seven Parts to gain esteem for his tribe in the eyes of the Wind Dukes of Aaqa
The location of several troves of treasure he has come across

item.title: Leejya
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: Stumbling upon her nest while adventuring in the mountains

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Small, fragile, with dark brown and black feathers
She is a mother devoted to the wellbeing of her children and tribe and she is a craftswoman who carves tools and weapons for her tribe out of wood
Frail, Claustrophobic and devoted to her eggs
That there is a lair of gargoyles nearby that have been waging war on her tribe
Protecting her children, providing for he tribe
The party rounds a corner on a warm mountain pass and discovers a small crater with a large nest in it.

item.title: Dakeelek
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: In the market of a large city

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Running a large roofless stall in an open air market selling herbal remedies and potions
Tall and Thin with ruffled brown and gray feathers
You Like buy? "What me get for you" "I show you how"
how to make potions of various kinds

She was exiled from her people because of her connection to other animals and creatures of the material realms. She studied under several Elvin Druids who raised her and eventually became a merchant because of her deire to help others and spread her knowledge
A wise old bird man with entirely gray mottled feathers, tiny hands, and bright intelligent eyes
I remember that book, I'll check the stacks", "SHHHHHH!!!"
Many Many secrets of the library

He left his home on the Elemental Planes of Air in order to enter the material world in the pursuit of knowledge. He learned common and enrolled in largest most prestigious school in the realm and has been here ever since
Auran, Common, Celestial, Draconic, Sylvan, Elvish, Dwarvish
He flaps down from the sky high archive shelves of the university library

item.title: Eikenziel Umbara
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: In battle with the forces of evil. A temple dedicated to lawful good gods

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: The divine plan for his life
Raised by clerics of the Temple of Mount Celestia, He was loosed on the work to smite evil, protect the weak and mete out th justice of the gods
He may approach a party to gain their aid in defeating some great evil. Or they may find him in mid-battle
He stand over 7' tall with long golden hair, pupiless, azure eyes and opalescent skin. He wears full shining plate and carries a great sword
Hold Evil Doer!, "By the Lords of Light!"
To curry the favor of his lawful good patron gods and smite evil wherever it resides

item.title: Nothuriel OathBreaker
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: At the head of a legion of the Undead

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: She is 7+' Tall and stunningly beautiful with long black hairm pupiless black eyes and silver skin. Dressed in full black plate with a flowing crimson cape and horned helmet
Pleasing her dark gods and extinguishing all that is good and light from the world
Fear and Destruction, that's it, that's all
the secrets of life after death. The goals of the lords of chaos
Lawful Good Holy Symbols, Certifiably Insane

Once a shining beacon of light and justice, Nothuriel stuck a deal with dark gods to bring he betrayed love back from the dead. Her lover was returned to her as a lich, driving her mad and causing her to embrace the darkness and do the bidding of the dark gods forever. Now she leads legions of the damned and undead against the light
She would only seek out a party to destroy them and all that is good in the world
two +2 Long swords, Cloak of Billowing, +2 Plate armor

item.title: Aezodel
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: hunting the forces of evil. In a tavern looking for information

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Tall with streaks of black and white hair, golden eyes and emerald skin. He wears full leather armor a duster and hat
The Pact of The Blade and serving his divine destiny

He was sent whole cloth by his patron god to hunt down and slay a specific demon and right any wrongs along his path. He made the Pact of The Blade to give himself the power and the tools to fulfill his destiny
He would seek out a party for information on local monsters or for aid in hunting a monster

item.title: Yufreni Dulask
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: At a party or festival or possibly a carnival or circus on the world of Kaladesh

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Tall, lithe, with a facesless pointed head with glowing blue eyes and dark gray/purplish skin. Wearing fine fuchsia silk robes and lots of multi-colored costume jewelry
Life is short, Join the Game, "We're all friends here".
They only care about the pursuit of pleasure and immediate gratification
They are passionate about life, love, the party, and pleasure
They have many contacts among their kind in the underworld and they have heard rumor of the Vampiric Gift
They are reckless and impulsive, always looking for the next high

Like the rest of their kind, Yufreni knows their days are numbered. Born from the Aether as they are toay, They live top have as much fun as they can in the short time they have, damn the consequences
Partying at a festival, Singing on stage, Inviting them to a carnival

item.title: Gothenni Vosk
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: but they will never meet Them unless the party has something They want
The party will hear rumors of Gothenni's existence

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: I have need of your services. "You have something that belongs to me". The party will be brought to meet Gothenni
Cloak of Invisibility, Boots of Elvinkind, +3 Dagger
What can you do for me?, "I will not be crossed!"
They are motivated by greed, jealousy and hunger
They know all of the secrets of Kaladesh and beyond
They are jealous and untrusting. But their biggest weakness is the hunger that comes with The Gift

They, like the others of their kind, were born whole-cloth from the Aether. They were trained as a thief and assassin for the previous crime lord and did his bidding until the day They were supposed to die. But Gothenni didn't want to die. Their will to live proved stronger than the nature of Their being and in Their final moment They absorbed the total life essence of their employer, extending Their life and ending his. From that point on, They took over as the new boss and continued to feed their Vampiric Hunger with anyone who crossed Them

They are tall and broad with a featureless black skinned hairless face with glowing blue eyes and a glow of blue cracks on various parts of their skin. They are adorned with fine robes over thick leather armor laces with gold filigree

item.title: Hathunti
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: A pub or a party on Kaladesh

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Small, lithe and faceless with shining blue eyes and fine leather armor covering ashen skin
Boom!!!, "Coming Through!, Wasn't here, Nobody saw nuthin!" "Fire is your friend!"
The unbridled excitement of absolute chaos. The thrill of danger
The thrill and adrenaline that comes with danger and chaos
Where the rebel groups meet and their plans for disrupting the Consulate

Early in Their short life, Hathunti discovered their distaste for authority and the trill of danger. Since then, they have aligned themselves with the Kaladeshi rebels as the way they could cause the most chaos and disruption for the Consulate authorities.
An explosion rocks a building one street over, an Aetherborn comes tearing around the corner barreling into the party
Varun can't resist antagonizing families linked to high culture. He brings attention to himself by flaunting his wealth.

You simply don't want to commit a crime in Invasaad without VarunBakerfield's blessing as his thieve's guild - the Bakerfield Family has a vice-like grip on the city's criminal underworld.

Varun Bakerfield developed his dog-eat-dog attitude growing up on the streets of Underboot [or another slum in a major city] in the shadows of the cosmopolitan city of Invasaad [or another major, advanced city.] To this day, he despises those born with a silver spoon in their mouths and the culture that they enjoy.

Supremely confident, he believes that what he lacks in book learning, he more than makes up for in raw intellect and street-smarts. Furthermore, he knows that if he cant win an argument with words, he can settle one with his fists, or his club "Widowmaker" just as easily.

As a natural leader, people have always naturally been drawn to him. It is this natural charisma combined with utter ruthlessness that allowed Varun to rise through the ranks of the criminal underworld until he was ready to start his own guild.

From there, he waged a war on the other guilds, winning turf wars with violence and cunning until he and his guild were the only street level gang standing.

During his rise, to help assure victory, Varun made a deal with a Lich named Ryxiltan. In exchange for a large portion of his guild's earnings, Ryxiltan used his magic to permanently increase Varun's strength and leadership presence going as far as giving him the ability to bend weak-minded criminals to his will whenever he pleased while also giving him the gift of extended life. The fact that he looks to be 40 years old despite being nearly 100 is the only visible vlue of the Lich's magic.

Being the servant of a powerful Lich is no easy task. Despite his success, Varun regrets the deal he made and is looking for ways to get himself out of it.

Varun is one of very few who know that the Bakerfield family is now run by a Lich who lives across the continent using the family's resources to further his quest to become a god. Varun also knows where all of the bodies are buried (metaphorically because he has his finger on the pulse of the city, and literally because he put a lot of the bodies there.)
constantly looking to physically dominate those in his presence. iron like handshakes, hard slaps on the back, etc
Amassing wealth to validate his intellect to the city's elite and getting out of his deal with the Lich Ryxiltan
Varun collects rare art, books and other symbols of culture and locks them away simply so aristocrats can't use them
Broad shoulders, no neck. Big, powerful. Huge hands. Acne scars, dark, thinning hair, olive skin
you may bow to the queen, but I run these streets; i know what it's like to be poor and hungry. rich is better"
Either through introduction from one of his lieutenants, by infiltrating his manor, or by committing a big enough crime
Innately cast charm person as a 4th level spell slot without using components or verbal commands twice per day. The effects of the charm spell last 3 times as long as normal

Varun's great club, "Widowmaker" is never far from his grasp. It was imbued with a strong magic that makes it easier and faster to wield by the Lich whom he secretly serves. Mechanically, it is a +3 magic weapon. Varun has had this club since he was a teenager, living on the streets of Underboot [or any slum in the major city who's criminal underworld he now runs]. He could barely wield it then

item.title: Hogarrk
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: Stalking Caverns or Dungeons. Working as security or an enforcer for a thieves or assassins guild or lair

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: He is a massive hulking beast standing almost 8 feet tall and 350lbs. He is wearing what looks like reclaimed pieces leather armor. His skin is a hair-covered dark tan brown and his hair dark brown and unkempt. He has large pointed ears and a bestial face. He carries a large, heavy, spiked mace with a handle made of bone
password?, "you should have had the password", "Hogarrk SMASH!!!"
He is large, unkempt and dumb as a brick. He regularly picks his nose and picks his teeth with the spikes on his mace
He is about as smart as paint and because of this he is easily confused or tricked

Driven out of his clan when he was challenged by a younger, stronger Bugbear for the role of pack alpha, he went into exile rather than die fighting for leadership.

He wandered for several years fending for himself before he was captured by slavers and sold into servitude as an enforcer/security. He found that he relished his new role as it provided a steady meal, a frequent outlet for his aggression and as little thinking as possible
The party discovers a secret entrance to the local thieve's guild, Hogarrk stands inside the door asking for a password
A huge bone-handled mace covered in spikes that counts as a +1 magical great club

item.title: Ahktoma
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: In the ancient libraries of Naktamun

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Tall and slender with a long neck, a long pointed bill, dark feathers on her head and shoulders with long graceful wings extending from her shoulders. She wears the traditional flowing white robes with gold bands around the collars of Kefnet's Chosen
The God's have not always been like this, "There was once a world beyond the Hekma"
She is wise and regal and carries herself lightly. She frequently stops to almost nervously preen the feathers on her wings with he long bill
She cares for the pursuit of knowledge instead of the martial prowess glorified by most of her society.
About Finding the Truth of Amonkhet's past
That the God-Pharaoh is not what he seems
She is desperate to get the truth out before its too late and that has the potential to make her sloppy

In her youth she was like the rest of her crop, she spent all of her time training for The Trials. One day while training in the Library of Kefnet, somebody left out an old ancient tome for her to discover that revealed pieces of the true history of Amonkhet [or any country within your campaign setting]. Since then she has devoted her life to researching and uncovering the real history of her world while hiding her search from her superiors
She may seek them out to reveal to the the terrifying truth she has discovered about the coming of the God-Pharaoh

item.title: Baruvo
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: As a member of the city guard
watch or as an army recruiter

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: He is a massive built soldier with a brown and white-dappled horses body with a ripped, muscular, tanned human head and torso with matching brown hair on his head. He wears full ceremonial armor and carries a longbow and a spear
Ho there brave adventurer! Have you considered joining the City Watch?, "Halt! Intruder!"
He seems to incessantly canter in place while reciting his recruitment. He does have a fantastic public speaking voice though
He's motivated by honor and glory. By making his tribe and family proud and living up to the example of his ancestors
Hes passionate about the army, BOY is he passionate about the army!
Proud to a fault and not necessarily the sharpest knife in the drawer

His family has a long history of military service and trained his whole life to follow in his ancestors footsteps. He joined up the day he turned of age and has never looked back. Advancing through the ranks quickly and his devotion and natural charisma made him a prime candidate for recruiting officer. Baruvo loves his job
They would encounter him at a recruiting center or or recruitment booth at a local even or fair.

item.title: Noel
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.category: Any place accepting or secluded: a local temple (bell tower)
Lone wonderer / outcast / no use for money

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: A metal figure, rusted and dented. Well used metals and worn leather armor. looks like body was not well taken care of.
When Noel can't remember something, they grind their metal mouth. They tap their head as they think.
Noel knows they use to be someone, but they cannot remember who. They search for answers.
Noel loves all animals. They have found nothing but love from forest creatures and will always give kindness in return.
They do not know much about their past, but they do know of one name, though not to whom it belongs to.
Noel would give their all in protecting any animal from harm, just as though they would to protect their allies.

Noel was not always a warforged. They remember the grass upon their feet and the taste of mead, but nothing else, not even their name.

The name Noel comes from an old manufacturing plate located on the body they woke up in: Number 31 (No.31). The body was long ago discarded.

Noel awoke in a mass grave of warforged with only a name in their head. The are not sure if the name is theirs or if it is someone they once knew. They have been searching for answers to no prevail.

They have been kicked out of towns and shunned from inns for the way they look. They have only ever found sanctuary in temples and alone in the woods. They have resorted to requesting local clerics to ask around about the faceless name for any answers.

The true backstory of this character is up to the DM. Is this character somehow connected to your party or the BBEG?

were they in a romantic partnership with a necromancer or Lich and when they died, their partner did everything they could to bring them back? Were they a warlock that made a deal with their patron? After they died did the patron put their soul into a machine for them to continue to serve? Are those memories actually their own, or are they being manipulated?

There are so many possibilities, that I wouldn't feel right cementing only one background for this character. Adjust as needed for your own campaign.
Mysterious figure in the bell tower causes rumors by locals. No memories and needs help figuring out their past.
Lone wonderer / outcast / no use for money

Noel starts as a Ranger. When the DM reveals more information about Noel's past through the story, Noel is able to reflect those changes on their character sheet: Meaning that if in Noel's past, the DM reveals they were a thief, Noel could obtain proficiency in thief's tools, or even multiclass as a rogue. This special ability can happen at anytime and is not related to experience, but is up to the DM.

There are some downsides to having amnesia. When Noel finds out about their past, if events go against their current alignment, Noel would make a wisdom saving throw (DC 10). If they fail, they take 1d4 physic damage and that damage is removed from their max HP.
Noel has a unique mask they found in a dump. it is a bit cracked in places. It resembles a comedy mask from a traveling theater.
Looking for a guide through a heavily forested area, the party approaches the local adventurer's guild to hire one
Small and Lithe with light brown hair tied back in a braid. Close fitting leather armor and a scar over her left eye
"Shhhhh!", "Something big has come this way recently", "I'll guide ya where ya need to go, maybe even in one piece"
regularly fusses at the scar over her eye. Fidgets with a small rabbit's foot on her belt
Loves an adventure, Likes to explore, hates orcs
Has a passion for the freedom of nature and the wild
Knows where a den of forest Trolls live
Homesick, trusts heavily in luck and is superstitious about it

Andrel grew up in a reclusive tribe of Ghostwise and was trained early as a hunter and scout. Unlike a lot of her tribe, she was seized by the wanderlust that afflicts many Halflings, she left the deeps woods and ventured out into society to make her name. Her reputation as a hunter and guide precedes her and is widely regarded as one of the best people to help travelers find their way safely through any section of woodland. Over the years she has also developed a strong distaste for orcs and their regular attempts to ambush travelers.
Favoured Enemy: Orc, Goblin, Giant, Natural Explorer, Ranger Spellcasting, Fighting Style: Archery, Primeval Awareness, Extra Attack, Land's Stride
Dread Ambusher, Umbral Sight, Iron Mind, Gloom Stalker Spells
Prefer's Distance Fighting, but isn't afraid to mix it up close and personal if she has to

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: https://getvibrantgames.com.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

item.title: About us and the NPC database
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.content:encoded:
Creating Vibrant Games Together

Tolkien is dead. It's time to create fantasy with more than handsome knights rescuing beautiful princesses. It's time for fantasy role-playing to move beyond "good" white-skinned elves saving the world from "evil" dark-skinned orcs by shooting them in the back. Let's try something different.

We're bringing D&D NPCs, settings and worlds into the 21st century.

Let's be INCLUSIVE. We're doing away with bland racial and gender stereotypes, and instead creating vibrant, memorable individual characters, with their own motivations, personalities and story arcs. Let's be IMMERSIVE. We're leaving behind the nondescript tavern and vague, generic medieval town, and instead creating vibrant, unique settings and scenes, where the story and the role-playing continue to bloom. Let's be IMAGINATIVE. We're looking past the narrow view of northern Europe, and instead creating vibrant worlds full of rich, vivid hues, painted from the palettes of global history, global cultures, global fantastic literature, and above all, our own inspired colours, mixed from the tinctures of our unique, individual ideas and experiences.

We're making fantasy role-playing VIBRANT.

Come join us, let's create vibrant new worlds together.

the d&d npc database

Our first project is to build the world's most comprehensive database of compelling, memorable NPCs that any DM, anywhere can use in their world whether their campaign setting is based on one of the official WotC campaign settings or it is homebrewed entirely from their imagination.

Why an NPC database and not an NPC generator?

We have nothing against random generators. But, there's only so much machines can do. We believe that human imagination can build richer backstories, more cohesive personalities, and ultimately more interesting people which we believe creates a richer, more immersive world which makes gaming more fun.

item.title: The Trouble with Defining NPC Occupations
item.dc:creator: richard
item.content:encoded:
Carly is a relatively new Dungeon Master. She is guiding a group of friends through a D&D 5e campaign module with which many of us are familiar - the Lost Mines of Phandelver. Ed Greenwood, the original creator of the Forgotten Realms campaign world, is the author of this module. It is a sophisticated and accessible example of how the game ought to be played.

Ed introduces many different NPCs. From the dwarf Gundren Rockseeker and his brothers - the fulcrum around which the adventure is hooked - to Sildar Hallwinter - the gaunt and etiquette-minded former knight and bodyguard to Gundren. These NPCs are certainly vibrant (could we expect any less from Ed?) as are the other NPCs that populate Phandalin, the important first township and community that players come across in the campaign.

Returning to Carly (and to the title of this post), she introduces Gundren and Sildar as Ed suggests. She reads the very Greenwoodian introductions to the players sitting across the table from her. Carly has done her homework and knows that Sildar is basically a 'hired gun' who protects Gundren. What does Gundren do with his days? How has he earned the gold he offers to the PCs? What kind of occupation does Gundren have that would, a. allow for him to be cavorting in a tavern mid-day; b. enable him to hire a retired knight as a bodyguard, and; c. lead him to stake a claim on the mines of Lost Echo Cave? Aren't these important questions to have answers to?

Well, if the party of players you are hosting are hack-n-slash murder hobos or merely care about treasure, maybe not. However, what happens once the party sparks up a conversation with Gundren or Sildar? A DM doesn't want to be rail-roaded into offering only the plot-point objectives as conversation content. As a fellow DM, I would say that most players want more out of their interactions with NPCs than simply plot points. What's more, this only does a disservice to the masterful authorship of someone like Ed Greenwood.

What a Person Does with Their Day

What a character does with their days is perhaps the most important component to fleshing out an NPC and making them vibrant. As we all know, in this gig-economy, your daily activities can hardly be confined to a single categorical title 'occupation'. People in the real world do many different things that define them. In today's world, many of us have many different jobs and aspirations. We shift from one to the next many times throughout our lives. Do any of these jobs define you as a person or do you define your job? A question left for the ages. We whole-heartedly believe that 'occupation' is a problematic category. It's a poor starting-point or crutch for role-playing or for a DM to unravel a plot for her players.

Let's turn our attention back to Carly and the NPCs for a moment. She has Gundren and Sildar to work with, for now, while the campaign begins. The player-characters encounter these two in a tavern and Ed Greenwood has given the outline as to how the PCs encounter these two characters. Carly is off to a good start. One huge BUT, especially in D&D: how will the players respond and interact with these two?

It's Supposed to be up the the Players!

As a DM, Carly definitely doesn't want to sap all of the fun out of the experience by rail-roading the players into a linear adventure. She doesn't want to 'force' them to confront the gangs that Sildar says are terrorizing the town. She doesn't want to 'force' the players to go investigate Cragmaw. Carly wants to give her players a feeling of adventure and that requires that things are mostly unpredictable; that the next steps are up to the players.

What does this have to do with the problem of 'occupation'? Well, it's simple. If the players ask Carly what Gundren or Sildar think that they should do next, no matter how great Ed Greenwood is at what he does, their response will be limited if Carly is considering their occupation. If Carly is slightly unprepared for this, then she may tell the players that Gundren wants them to go to the next stop in the adventure module. She might say that Gundren tells them to look for his missing brother. Gundren has some options.

Sildar, on the other hand, isn't necessarily one-dimensional, but he clearly acts as one might expect a former night and bodyguard to act. He makes suggestions about 'sherriffing' the town. Get the gang. But what else might Sildar say? How did he get where he is today? What made him become a knight? Which kinds of experiences did he have in that role? Answers to these types of questions would definitely inform his viewpoint and move Carly beyond ''stock'' answers for her players. What's more, Carly has now begun to weave a story that makes things more complex than a linear adventure.

Thinking Outside of the Box Makes it more of an Adventure!

The players are left to investigate even further with these additional story features. These act as not just mere 'red-herrings' that might throw players off the linear trail, but they also enable Carly to invent possible scenarios outside of the main story. Carly has unearthed the truest form of fun available to a Dungeon Master. She gets to create - outside of the bounds of labels and categories, weaving multiple labels and categories together.

Gundren is now not merely a business man nor miner nor explorer simply searching for the riches of Lost Echo Cave (nothing against Ed Greenwood here - there's only so much room in a module). Gundren is now a complex character with complex motivations. He's an adventurer and business man searching for a lost magical forge. He's a much richer character. This is even better exemplified when we consider Sildar.

Sildar is a retired knight turned bodyguard. Yes, he's associated with the Lord's Alliance - a faction developed by Lord Neverember while he rebuilds Neverwinter - but he can be so much more than that. Is he a mercenary? He probably isn't if he's associated with the Lord's Alliance. Well, then, why does he sell his services? Also, why does he bed-down at the Townmaster's Hall? Seems his 'occupation' as a former knight or bodyguard doesn't truly represent Sildar's character. Perhaps he's involved in politics. Maybe he's a dissenter. Perhaps he's involved in the plot!

What Brings the NPC to Where They are Now?

Let's look at a simpler example. Carly's players move on to the Stonehill Inn. They need a room. They meet Toblen Stonehill, described skillfully by Ed Greenwood as a former prospector who realized he knew more about keeping rooms than he knew about looking for precious metals. Is Carly limited to role-playing Toblen by asking a limited number of questions? Does Carly simply run the transaction and allow the PCs to have their long rest? Well, we argue that this does not make the most memorable and vibrant experience.

Carly realizes that Toblen is more than his occupation. Perhaps he is many different occupations. While he can offer the PCs what they are looking for, he can also offer so much more. Does he open their first contact with, "welcome to the Stonehill, how can I help you?"? Or does he open with conversation about the prospecting opportunities in the area? The second opening, it seems, not only lends itself to further plot-related discussions (i.e., about the lost mine) but also provides a richer experience for not just the players but also our DM, Carly. Before eventually turning the conversation back to, "ay, well, I've gotten carried away with myself, I bet you're here for a room", she's able to share a bit of lore about the area while Toblen shares his previous history as a prospector.

Conclusion

In short, NPCs become so much more vibrant - as does the fantasy world - when a DM doesn't confine themselves to the unavoidably diverse label of 'occupation'. In the middle ages, priests could also be scientists, farmers could also be stonemasons, barbers could also be surgeons; and this list could go on and on. The point is, occupation is a particularly complex category and by recognizing this you can enhance your game as a DM and heighten the enjoyment for your players. By confining your NPCs to an occupation, you are doing a disservice to your players and to yourself as a DM. Remember, D&D is long-form story-telling and at most times you are best off to leave certain things unanswered, uncategorized, and unlabeled. This leaves a touch of mystery and gives you flexibility to work out details in the future, should the need arise.

Links

Following is a list of interesting sites that can provide some insight about occupations in the Middle Ages:

Shawn Vincent (Highly Recommended!)
Arcana Wiki
Medievalists
Wikipedia
Ancient Fortresses

And here is a list of links for you to peruse that explain the complex and problematic nature of the label 'occupation' for defining a character:

Ms. Sanchez' GT Class
Medieval Households
The Finer Times
DriveThru RPG

Also, please Check out the following Vibrant NPCs that simply cannot be forced into a category!

Ezio R'zlathe
Kraven Holtdmoore

item.title: Why NPCs are a great starting-point for building encounters, adventures, campaigns, or Realms!
item.dc:creator: vibrantgames
item.content:encoded:
At Vibrant Games, we take Non-Player Characters (NPCs) seriously. We believe they are the best starting point for Dungeon Masters looking to create encounters, adventures, campaigns, and Realms more generally.

Let's put this in perspective. Personalize it, you might say. You, Ms. or Mr. Dungeon Master, are looking to create a memorable series of sessions for your players - whether friends, families, or even mere acquaintances. The entire purpose of running D&D sessions is to create fun and memorable moments - be it puzzles, battles, or what-have-you - for those players. Whether you start at session zero, or you are a new or experienced DM, your goal is clearly to create exciting story-lines that the players will remember for a long time. Well, let's take a look at what makes your life memorable and exciting, shall we?

Watering it down for the sake of simplicity and getting the point across clearly, let's say you, Ms. or Mr. Dungeon Master, need to restock your pantry and fridge. You go to the grocery store or to the market, right? Which store or market? Do you choose the cheapest place? Or, perhaps, you choose the location with the best selection - the best variety or highest quality goods. Regardless of any of these choices for where you go, what makes the experience memorable and worthy of telling others? We argue that it isn't the location nor the products or services offered there. Rather, it's the people you interact with that make any experience worthy of story-telling.

Yes, yes. An old adage says:

Great minds discuss ideas;

Average minds discuss events;

Small minds discuss people.

This only really applies when it comes to discussions about ideas. We could replace the term ideas with whatever other term is a popular political or scientific concept. However, what this adage overlooks is that the quality of the first two concepts - ideas and events - depend on the kinds and quantities of people. Without people, the other two don't matter. The vibrance and quality of the people involved almost exclusively determines the vibrance and quality of the events and ideas.

This is our perspective of story-telling. Especially long form story-telling; the kind that characterizes good D&D campaigns. Fables and myths might focus on a moral lesson, but those are short-form stories. Like the newly popularized 'one-shots' we see proliferating role-playing culture. These short-form stories can be tons of fun, don't get us wrong, but they aren't the typical example of D&D. Dungeons & Dragons, from its inception, has been about long-form stories and especially about the characters that players create. It's the player characters that truly shape the narrative. And we believe that in the best campaigns NPCs aren't any different.

So, back to the original point. Why NPCs are a great starting point for building adventures and whole worlds. NPCs are the points-of-contact, they are the 'life' of the world within which the player-characters are adventuring. Plot points, lore, treasure - in one way or another all of these key components to an enjoyable experience with D&D begin with some person or group of persons. Why are NPCs a great starting point? We believe that we've addressed that, so let's instead turn to how to use NPCs as a starting point for building adventures and towns and cities and more!

Well, let's use an example. Begin with a stock NPC - a tavernkeeper. Mundane, right? Not necessarily. Allow your mind to wander for a moment. Every single character or persona in a fantasy realm should raise a nearly endless set of questions. Of course, the beginning questions are, what race? What class? What level? What equipment? What loot? If we move beyond the stock questions (remember, you've let your mind wander now) you start asking what motivates this character? What life-objectives do they have? What are they passionate about? What secrets might they hold? Once you start answering some of these questions with an engaged imagination - that is, without tying your mind down to some notion that it has to connect to already existing ideas from other people - you are wandering down roads that have never been adventured! You have begun to weave together the first threads of a fabric that makes a town, a region, a political or religious faction...you've begun creating a world!

Beginning with NPCs - How to Do Them Right

Questioning what the heck you are doing is natural while DM-ing. As the Angry GM details in this article, NPCs ought to be considered central elements of your game. The best sessions never view NPCs as throw-away elements that are only used to forward the plot. But, at the end of his article the Angry GM delineates between the RP and the G. That is, there is role-playing and then there is the Game. At Vibrant Games, we couldn't disagree more. What we can agree with is how he points out that the 'G', the Game, emerges from the Role-playing and vice versa. We see these elements as inseparable.

High stakes D&D brands, like Critical Role, seamlessly weave the two together. 'Doing NPCs Right' means that your role-playing elements are the game. In other words, any living, breathing thing, or maybe even a darned tree, can and should become a non-player character. The players come across a horde of giant spiders in a cavern that are swarming the bodies of fallen prospectors. You aren't just presenting a battle, you are presenting a multi-faceted scene consisting of multiple characters: The spiders, the dead prospectors, and even the cavern itself. Everything should be considered a 'character' in the sense that it impacts the story and the outcome isn't certain.

By uncertainty we are suggesting that you, as a DM, cannot assume that you have written the scene from start to finish. The outcome of the scene is uncertain and should remain so. This is how NPCs are 'done right' and how they lend themselves to fantastic world-building potentials. Letting your imagine get carried away with uncertainties - without the need to nail down the name of a town or the complexities of a political faction - allows you the freedom to explore.

We have found that by generating NPCs from this place of imaginative freedom allows one to use broad brushstrokes. You can suggest that some nefarious religion is responsible for a particularly nasty character trait or that family troubles have led to an especially heroic objective. Fantasy fiction can be so rewarding when you allow your mind to create without confinement. Connect a nasty upbringing with a rigid religious practice. Stretch a 'typical' racial characteristic into a complete rebellion of identity. A dwarven Paladin has rejected the deity of his forefathers and follows an Old Forgotten God of Fire and Light. He has chosen a new path and seeks to bring the races back to their roots where they will find true peace.

Reinventing the World You Live in

Take chances. Address controversial subjects. Think way outside the box. The current explosion in popularity for D&D has been accompanied by critiques of undertones of racial inequality and colonialism. While these critiques are quite correct, they also enable us to use our imaginations even further to make this amazing game a means for adapting the cultures in which we live. We can use these tools to create NPCs that challenge the status quo and even the challengers themselves. Why would it be wrong to create a fantasy character, an Orc, who is proud of his status as outsider? They are an exemplar of the 'Other' and proud to remain that way. Let's take this a step further to expand on the topic of this blog entry.

This NPC hails from a tribe of northern tundra Orcs. They are largely isolated. They've developed to be unique in skin tone and tradition. They have established peace with some nearby kingdoms of other races but these alliances remain tenuous. Why? Well, because these Orcs continue raiding and pillaging caravans and small settlements. They are brutish and pleased by their continued devolvement. These are the 'Others' that are problematic to some members of the public. However, we suggested above that we ought to create characters that lead to asking questions. This should be no different. Consider why this tribe is aggressive and proud to devolve.

Imagine that they are doing so because of their role as the 'Other'. For years, the nearby kingdoms have been performing unethical raids on this northern Kingdom. The 'good', colonial images are thus torn asunder. It was an NPC we chose to create that would lead to this broader 'world-building' exercise. A half-Orc who denounces his human blood. He identifies as a 'true' Orc because he believes that being an Orc is rooted more so in one's beliefs than blood. This Orc, we will call him Bruukoz from the Bender-of-Rocks clan, has been banished from his tribe because he refuses their peaceful ways. Bruukoz is the anti-hero in juxtaposition to the outcry that racial and colonial injustice is embedded in the game. Instead, we have a hero who stands against those same injustices yet embodies the concrete realities that such claims tend to overlook.

Not only have we begun to create a world from one NPC but also created a tool for changing how people think about the real world in which we live.

Invitation to Our Readers

We invite our readers to create something similar to what we provided above. We're sure the community can create something far better. Please leave a comment with a character that could lead to: a. the creation of a world, town, or what-have-you, and; b. changing the thinking patterns of the peoples around us for the better.

Here is another example from the Vibrant Database, a half-orc/half-dwarf roofer/contractor who is inherently racist:
ALBRECHT MUKHT

Why is Albrecht racist? Who are the Orcish slavers from which he hails? He is a fine example of how to build a different D&D world while also questioning the world in which we live.

Some links:

World-Building:
11 STEPS FOR BUILDING A HOMEBREW WORLD FOR D&D
WorldBuilding - DND Compendium
10 Dungeons & Dragons World-Building Tips For New Dungeon Masters

Race:
The Problem of Race in DND | 5E+
Dungeons & Dragons first attempt to address RPGs race problems disappoints its community
Dungeons & Dragons' Racial Reckoning Is Long Overdue

Some Vibrant Examples of NPCs as a World-Building Catalyst:
DEONNE MATTRIEU DEVARIA
GLEADRIC & CUJULOA
MOSS
THE PENNYMORE CON

We believe that these NPCs have aspects that were discussed in the above article. They provide leads on a world that could be built.
